More than half of all road traffic deaths occur among:
🚶‍♂️ pedestrians
🚴‍♀️ cyclists
🏍️ motorcyclists

More from @WHO on Sunday's World Day of Remembrance for Road Traffic Victims: https://t.co/MC2fJ2TGZR https://t.co/WxctrMRBpY

In Nigeria, the climate crisis is causing conflict between farmers & herders.

See how the UN is helping by training farmers on new agricultural techniques, while also promoting women's rights and the inclusion of ethnic groups. https://t.co/uyGpELQrlD #ClimateAction https://t.co/uoCQv0faFL

Having a nationality is a fundamental human right. 

As #COVID19 worsens the struggle of stateless people around the world, @Refugees is calling on countries to take urgent measures to #EndStatelessness by 2024. https://t.co/EqnE9cTIxP

More than 1.3 million people die in road accidents every year. The #GlobalGoals aim to save lives by improving road safety. 

Sunday is World Day of Remembrance for Road Traffic Victims. https://t.co/JvNdfcaxRz https://t.co/Wm7P0G74pj

5 measures to protect you and others from #COVID19:
🧴 Handwashing
😷Wearing masks
🤧covering cough & sneezes
🙂↔️🙂maintaining 6ft distance
🏠 Stay home when sick

We Are #InThisTogether. More from @WHO: https://t.co/ryLMRM44KW https://t.co/cK8AUTE2JZ
Happy #Diwali to all those celebrating! https://t.co/Cz4EoGgAJp

Every day, brave women are #ServingForPeace in UN missions to help build a better & more peaceful🌍

Learn about their work, including how you can join them & make a difference in the lives of some of the world's most vulnerable people. https://t.co/zSM4ypM3it via @UNPeacekeeping https://t.co/be9V008BvY

9 out of 10 people around the world breathe highly polluted air. 

Be a #ClimateAction superhero - bike, walk or take public transport whenever possible to help protect our air from dangerous fumes. https://t.co/nAjeCApKJ4 #ActNow https://t.co/VXmLZkBqJV

Exercise 🏃‍♀️🚴⛹️‍♀️
Eat healthy 🍎🥦🥕
Avoid tobacco use 🚭

Simple actions can help prevent or delay type 2 diabetes. Learn more on Saturday's #WorldDiabetesDay: https://t.co/HEdlsClTnA via @WHO https://t.co/K1Rjv9Plef

शुभ #दिवाली!

During #Diwali, the festival of lights - celebrated in India & by followers of many faiths across the world - clay lamps are lit to signify the victory of good over evil. https://t.co/aSr33MgYSd

Our cultural heritage is threatened by:
• Illicit trafficking
• Fraudulent online & offline sales
• Illegal excavations

More from @UNESCO on Saturday's first-ever Int'l Day against Illicit Trafficking in Cultural Property: https://t.co/oypvnsTbBx #ProtectHeritage https://t.co/kov5dvccVY

#COVID19 has exposed chronic under-investment in public health & a major re-think in how all societies value health is now needed, said @WHO chief @DrTedros as #WHA73 wrapped up on Friday.  https://t.co/vTQanZp0wl

#दीपावली की शुभकामनाएं!

A happy and safe #Diwali to all those who are celebrating! https://t.co/a3fJK0baN5

People with diabetes are at increased risk of severe #COVID19 complications & many are not receiving adequate treatment due to service disruptions.

On Saturday's #WorldDiabetesDay, @WHO launches programme to help countries prevent & manage the disease. https://t.co/6l0A382yn7 https://t.co/UswwOQ4vgE
On Friday's #WorldKindnessDay, check out some of the ways people are coming together & showing unity during the #COVID19 crisis, in our latest  @TwitterMoments. https://t.co/i0oKxjL3uy

#COVID19 has demonstrated how we are all interconnected and need to work together to overcome global challenges. 

On Friday's #WorldKindnessDay, and every day, join us in spreading compassion, kindness & hope in the face of the pandemic.  

🎨: Nat Bullard https://t.co/NhkeauBASD

Amid the pandemic, misinformation can be deadly.

Taking time to verify facts before sharing something online is an act of kindness & can help stop the spread of #COVID19.

#PledgeToPause on Friday's #WorldKindnessDay and every day: https://t.co/q5ZFkRwXkH https://t.co/4zZw5b4tSi

To stay safe, some of us may need to be physically apart, but love holds us together. 

Friday’s #WorldKindnessDay is an opportunity to show solidarity and prove how small acts of kindness can go a long way during the pandemic. 

🎨: Daniel Stevens https://t.co/zMPUpQtiuN

"As we continue working towards #COP26, the UN will do everything we can to mobilize a global coalition in favor of carbon neutrality."

-- @antonioguterres at #ParisPeaceForum2020. https://t.co/x3ZnnLCIGH https://t.co/UiKM0RBs1B

The worldwide response to #COVID19 has demonstrated the power of solidarity. People are spreading kindness through their words & deeds -- while inspiring others to do the same.

Join the movement on Friday's #WorldKindnessDay! 

🎨: Margaret To https://t.co/QwSvCDYfYx

As measles cases surge worldwide to the highest number in 23 years, @WHO warns that, even amid #COVID19, access to routine immunizations is critical to save lives. https://t.co/FY68SYJtli #VaccinesWork https://t.co/UojHkWdxSC

"We need to join our voices to those who say 'Help Us. Help Me.'"

--@Refugees chief @FilippoGrandi explains how #COVID19 has affected the world's refugee communities.

UNHCR continues to protect refugees & displaced people amid #coronavirus. https://t.co/YFVEnsgk1x https://t.co/YWyqXWWuz4

Pneumonia claims the lives of more than 800,000 children every year - more than any other infectious disease.

Disruptions to health services caused by #COVID19 could put even more lives in danger. Get details from @UNICEF on #WorldPneumoniaDay.
https://t.co/WYvWnPpUA1

To mark the 20th anniversary of landmark Security Council resolution 1325 on women, peace & security, @UNYouthEnvoy is recognizing young women’s unique contributions to building peace within their communities 🕊
 
Join the conversation by sharing your story using #YouthLead. https://t.co/EkI6uku1Rn

Pneumonia kills more than 800,000 children every year, accounting for 15% of all deaths of children under 5.

On Thursday's #WorldPneumoniaDay, see how @WHO is working to o protect, prevent & treat pneumonia in children. https://t.co/m4gbqQ0ehL https://t.co/xNQUKjqMvd

On Wednesday, @iaeaorg chief @RafaelMGrossi spoke at #UNGA about efforts to tackle #COVID19 and the climate crisis, as well as the role of nuclear technologies in achieving #GlobalGoals around the world. https://t.co/Kk0OVYCMai https://t.co/nePwqnbOjZ

Pacific Small Island Developing States are among the most vulnerable when it comes to the impacts of the climate crisis.

A new @UNEP programme aims to support them through climate & ocean information services and multi-hazard early warning systems.
https://t.co/3VHW4VOaAR

Pneumonia is an acute respiratory infection that can be prevented by:
💉 Immunization 
🍎 Adequate nutrition
💨 Addressing environmental factors

More from @WHO on Thursday's #WorldPneumoniaDay: https://t.co/xbpSSQQh7P https://t.co/Zq7nn5LL32

Without a nationality, stateless people may face a lifetime of exclusion & discrimination. 

@Refugees Goodwill Ambassador Cate Blanchett explains why we must #EndStatelessness and make sure everyone can say "#IBelong". https://t.co/tFjZASgvA7 https://t.co/OFA4DuLYFs

"Now is the time for a collective new push for peace & reconciliation."
-- @antonioguterres has appealed for a global ceasefire amid #COVID19.

On Wednesday's #ArmisticeDay, join the Secretary-General's call for peace in all corners of the world:  https://t.co/ik97kjI9Zu https://t.co/myKlfaIfMj

Happy birthday to our Messenger of Peace, @LeoDiCaprio, and thank you for your tireless commitment to #ClimateAction!

Here's how you can join him in protecting our planet: https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV #ActNow https://t.co/wfTUF2uxGY

#DecentWork impacts not only the well-being of workers, but also their families. 

@UNICEF and @GlobalCompact are calling on businesses to create family-friendly workplaces amid #COVID19.  https://t.co/Ggzek9FyVb https://t.co/xuFNZyEQjU

During her visit to Nigeria, @AminaJMohammed kicked off the #TakeTheBall campaign in support of the #GlobalGoals, launched #GenerationEquality, met with internally displaced people & much more. https://t.co/j89WZqN719 https://t.co/EHMAKZdeJf

The #ParisAgreement requests each country to outline their #ClimateAction plans, also known as their Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs).

Find out how your country plans to protect our planet and our future here: 
https://t.co/3uqESpniGN

https://t.co/TBmT2lfyBe

#COVID19 has made life unbearably difficult for those living in places already grappling with humanitarian emergencies.

@UNOCHA spotlights 10 crises the international community cannot afford to neglect amid the pandemic. https://t.co/W8f3s6God6

"It's really important to get factual information out there, because we are dealing with people's lives & health."

-- Naledi Masheshi from @AfricaCheck shares how fact checkers help contain the spread of misinformation online.

Get verified information: https://t.co/GqzOfW2S9r https://t.co/sOeajiBqoF

Households consume 29% of global energy and contribute to 21% of CO2 emissions. 

Be a #ClimateAction hero - never waste electricity & always turn off the lights you don't need. https://t.co/nAjeCAHlAC #ActNow https://t.co/JLby2iyVg9

Libya: @IntlCrimCourt Prosecutor Fatou Bensouda urges warring parties to implement their recent historic ceasefire agreement & tells Security Council that perpetrators of atrocity crimes will be brought to justice. 
https://t.co/M25UY5YTwh

To defeat the #COVID19 pandemic, we have to ensure open, inclusive and collaborative science. Reliable information needs to be accessible to everyone, everywhere. 

More on Tuesday's World #ScienceDay for Peace & Development:
https://t.co/OZTsALokMu

In Nigeria, @AminaJMohammed highlights the UN's support to #COVID19 response as well as the continued importance of the #GlobalGoals. 
https://t.co/j89WZqN719

#COVID19 is impacting people's income & food security.

While everyone is affected, migrants & displaced people are among the hardest hit.

A new @WFP & @UNmigration study explores the dynamic between migration, mobility & hunger during the pandemic. https://t.co/OQARXV3XiC https://t.co/bCuw2QJbzw

🚚 A truck
🚁 A helicopter
& sometimes both. 

#NobelPrize winning @WFP uses whatever means necessary to transport life-saving aid to those most in need & achieve #ZeroHunger. https://t.co/ovSIx8fylG

https://t.co/BY3Qa8Q0pV

The world needs science, and science needs women. 👩‍🔬🧪

On Tuesday's World #ScienceDay for Peace & Development, @UNESCO  explains the importance of equal access to education in science, technology, engineering & mathematics (STEM): https://t.co/nRkpTKbn5h https://t.co/GCkZsmxgTQ

"Together we can achieve carbon neutrality for a sustainable future."

-- @antonioguterres urges all governments, cities, financial institutions & private businesses to establish their transition plans for net zero emissions by 2050. https://t.co/1IbeGXPK8u #ClimateAction https://t.co/lBF52AXGca

Tuesday is 🌏 #ScienceDay for Peace & Development: 
https://t.co/y9vtt1nCjl https://t.co/xDkSpynusT

"The United Nations is your steadfast ally in the essential struggle to uphold equality and dignity for all."

-- @antonioguterres as he receives the @WorldJewishCong' Theodor Herzl Award on the anniversary of #Kristallnacht. https://t.co/taZHkIP9Zk https://t.co/80f68IquxU

Science is key to understanding our world, from #COVID19 to the causes of the climate emergency.

“You have gathered today to continue forging a new era of peace & stability for Libya. You have the opportunity to end a tragic conflict & create a future of dignity and hope."

-- @antonioguterres on the launch of the Libyan Political Dialogue Forum. https://t.co/J1cWmSR0vK

#COVID19 and the new global coalition to improve access to tests, vaccines & treatments will be key areas of focus at this week's World Health Assembly. 

@WHO has more on what will be discussed at #WHA73: https://t.co/TNbW1JbT2m

The partnership between the United States & the UN is an essential pillar of the int'l cooperation needed to address the dramatic challenges facing the world today, @antonioguterres reaffirms, congratulating @JoeBiden & @KamalaHarris on the US election.
https://t.co/byUOfIkg1w

While our race to zero emissions is a formidable challenge, these Dialogues show that together, we can work towards achieving the goals of the #ParisAgreement.

-- @UNFCCC chief @PEspinosaC at #RaceToZero Dialogues, which aim to accelerate #ClimateAction. https://t.co/7i22cxFnDz https://t.co/Yjnm6Wqcz9

Share these tips for talking to children about misinformation, including helping them tell fact from fiction.

The UN works for gender equality so every woman & girl can exercise her human rights & live up to her full potential.

Now, more than ever, we must work for equality, dignity, peace & all the ideals of the UN Charter. https://t.co/PhNh4SlZsY #UN75 https://t.co/dQnJeZA7Cc

The #COVID19 crisis has fundamentally changed the digital world. 

This month's #IGF2020 explores how safe & reliable data will be key to the pandemic recovery. https://t.co/gIUqjMJKnj https://t.co/JCMLsnm1nr

Nurses & midwives make up the largest group of healthcare workers in the world - and they are on the frontlines of the #COVID19 response. 

Today & every day, let's show solidarity and #SupportNursesAndMidwives. https://t.co/1DVI8bWFwF https://t.co/imawFfYh2D

It's the International Week of Science & Peace! 🕊️🔬

Discover the links between science & tech and peace & security: https://t.co/z4FF9mYi72 https://t.co/Ne4nWujGBk

Hunger is on the rise worldwide, with four hotspots facing potential famine: Burkina Faso, northeastern Nigeria, South Sudan & Yemen.

@WFP calls for urgent action to avoid a major emergency & save lives. https://t.co/nx7mj3Xovs https://t.co/OeSEQhsQCB

"We will never, ever give up making this world better for everyone, everywhere."

-- @antonioguterres sums up the mission of the UN as the Organization turns 75. 

More about our work: https://t.co/AvGarodG2L #UN75 https://t.co/Qada4rufNw

4 out of 10 people in Syria are food insecure, the highest number ever recorded.

Nutritious food from @WFP is a lifeline for millions of people who are struggling to rebuild their lives in the country. https://t.co/qY16kbAsin https://t.co/GUKFzlrCTK

The #BerlinWall, built in 1961, fell 31 years ago. 

A section of it, entitled "Trophy of Civil Rights", was gifted to the UN by Germany and is displayed at UNHQ in NYC as a reminder that we can all #StandUp4HumanRights. https://t.co/8Z3zfjRKNf

"Saving children is what matters to me. This is what makes my day, every single day."
-- Dr. Issiaka Toure treats children with severe acute malnutrition in Sahel.

Read his and similarly powerful stories from @UNOCHA:  https://t.co/DaUjWlAdqJ https://t.co/0CDtN89F1e

From low self-esteem to depression, the consequences of cyberbullying can be devastating for young people. 

Following this week's first-ever #StopBullying Day, @UNICEF helps shed light on the dangers of cyberbullying & how to prevent it. https://t.co/cQvaXL8DlB

Women are on the front lines of the #COVID19 response, yet stories of their leadership are often overlooked.

@UN_Women goes beyond the headlines to share 5 stories of how women are leading the way in the pandemic response. https://t.co/zGV0KWQe2y https://t.co/7Ptmbmpr4o

Communities, Governments and the UN family show us how important it is to stay connected, organize and help each other during #COVID19. Find inspiration in our latest @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/VNQo05c0kC

Scientists are working round the clock to help end the pandemic. Now, they're inviting us into their labs and homes. 

#TeamHalo gives us an exclusive look at the global effort to find a #COVID19 vaccine. https://t.co/yd1ZeYAbIB https://t.co/93gdINKkUq

Climate change is a menace to our world. 

Our league of superheroes is taking #ClimateAction and they want YOU to join them! 

Get to know them all and find out how you can #ActNow: https://t.co/nAjeCApKJ4 https://t.co/9WaC7cejYJ

Meet Chief Inspector Doreen Malambo -- she is the 2020 UN Woman Police Officer of the Year for her commitment to empowering women & fighting gender-based violence. 

Read more about this @UNPOL officer #ServingForPeace in South Sudan: https://t.co/aEZsqcyes9 https://t.co/xEKmbk6ULf

Viet Nam: About 1.5 million people have been affected by recent storms & floods.

@UNCERF is releasing $3 million to provide urgent, life-saving assistance to the most vulnerable. https://t.co/qA0z7VvkI2

#COVID19 is part of a growing trend of emerging zoonotic diseases, as habitat loss & wildlife exploitation reduce barriers between humans & animals.

@UNEP recommends steps for preventing future pandemics: https://t.co/vgvg0YM2N4 https://t.co/R4QFFwoY7b

Conflict, economic decline, the climate crisis & #COVID19 have left a record number of people facing food insecurity worldwide.

@FAO warns that four hotspots are facing potential famine amid rising levels of acute hunger. https://t.co/WjdsB6VaVM https://t.co/NzePL3UOI3

Sometimes misinformation can look rather convincing. 

Fact checkers from @FullFact explain how you can recognize misinformation and stop it from spreading. https://t.co/whK9LXhZGw #PledgeToPause https://t.co/FJwMbOcxpx

Against all odds. 
Whatever it takes. 
Wherever needed.

Around 9,000 @UNPOL officers from 94 countries are working to promote peace & security around the world. 

As #UNPoliceWeek comes to an end, we thank these brave men & women who are #ServingForPeace. https://t.co/JjXN6kZN56 https://t.co/SrK0xgKAYT

Looking away is not an option.

 https://t.co/AWAL96memq

Congratulations to Chief Inspector Doreen Malambo of Zambia for receiving the UN Woman Police Officer of the Year Award!
